techmeme.title: Steam hit 37M+ concurrent users on August 25 for the first time, up from the previous record of nearly 33.7M in January 2024, after Black Myth: Wukong's release (Andy Chalk/PC Gamer)
In France, Telegram is avidly used within political and media circles, including by President Emmanuel Macron, who has used the app for nearly a decade (Politico)
China's curbs on shipments of germanium and gallium, which are used to make chips, have led to an almost 2x increase in prices in Europe over the past year (Financial Times)
A profile of Pavel Durov, a devout techno-optimist who trolled authorities online, started social network VKontakte in 2006, and left Russia in 2014 for Dubai (New York Times)
Sony raises the PlayStation 5's price in Japan by 19% to ~$550, citing "the severe external environment, including recent global economic fluctuations" (Takashi Mochizuki/Bloomberg)
